description: Wellhead: square on top, round at the bottom; on one side an angel holding a shield supported by two lions passant; on opposite side rampant lion bearing column; on other two sides vases, one holding acanthus leaves and the other flowers; on each corner an acanthus leaf springing from bottom to support corner; two moldings around top.
dimension: W.38 x D.38 in.; overall weight 3170 lbs (well-head 2310 lbs; base 860 lbs)
provenance: Palazzo Zorzi, Venice (until at least 1911). [French & Co., New York, until 1915; sold, for $1,500, to Mia]
title: Well-head
